issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When deregistering an image that no longer exists, the error message returned is malformed (i.e. it doesn't match the return message that you get when running against AWS).

*[euca-deregister]*

{code}
# euca-deregister emi-5D0B37DC
DeregisterImageType: Get unique failed for ImageInfo using example: [ImageInfo imageName=null description=null architecture=null imagePublic=null platform=null imageType=null permissions=[] productCodes=[] deviceMappings=[] imageSizeBytes=null fullName=null ownerUserId=null ownerUserName=null ownerAccountNumber=null ownerAccountName=null uniqueName=null ownerFullNameCached=null state=null lastState=null stateChangeStack=null displayName=emi-5D0B37DC id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null]
{code}

*[ec2-deregister]*

{code}
$ ec2-deregister ami-2e4bf22f
Client.InvalidAMIID.NotFound: The image id '[ami-2e4bf22f]' does not exist
{code}

*[Reference]*

* http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DeregisterImage.html
* http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html (check InvalidAMIID.NotFound - maybe change this to InvalidEMIID.NotFound for Eucalyptus)
* http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/CommandLineReference/ApiReference-cmd-DeregisterImage.html

comments.body: Start investigation, and provide debugging output.

Code Review Request : EUCA-4868 euca-deregister returns malformed error message
Hi All,

May I please request a code review for : EUCA-4868 euca-deregister returns malformed error message

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-4868

diff :  git show --color 9784a0d8320d8bbadfb04281f42c2ebd71ed9979

Summary:  When a user enters a non existent imageId the error is not very user friendly and not consistent with AWS output.
          This is because ImageManager.deregister( DeregisterImageType request ) is just propagating EucalyptusCloudException thrown by
          EntityWrapper.getUnique( fexample ).
          


Solution: Catch the EucalyptusCloudException thrown by EntityWrapper.getUnique( fexample ) if the cause is an instance of
                    NoSuchElementException change the error message to be user friendly and more consistent with the AWS 
                    error output, else just re-throw the exception.
 

Unit test : 

Run:  euca-deregister emi-12345678  (non-existent imageId)

FAIL: DeregisterImageType: Get unique failed for ImageInfo using example: [ImageInfo imageName=null description=null architecture=null ....

PASS: DeregisterImageType: The image id '[emi-12345678]' does not exist


I have created eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/Euca4868

Thx Mike

[root@eucahost-51-81 precise]# euca-deregister blah
euca-deregister: error (DeregisterImageType): Invalid id: "blah"
[root@eucahost-51-81 precise]#
